title: Studyfinder
descriptionHtml: Worked in a team of 5 to conceptualize and prototype an app to help students find and rate study spaces on campus. Watch our problem space video.

title: Docs Overview page redesign
descriptionHtml: Implemented HTML components for site builder (Hugo) to organize all product landing pages. We designed this template to serve as a "nutrition label" for each Cloudflare product. I programmed the components to be flexible and extensible without cluttering Markdown code.

title: Argo Smart Routing docs
descriptionHtml: Authored new documentation for Argo Smart Routing by combining information from multiple different sources across the Cloudflare documentation. This new page acts as a single point-of-presence for Argo documentation for over three million monthly users.

title: Drops
descriptionHtml: Senior English capstone project exploring Internet archival history in the form of an imaginary pseudo-retro operating system.

title: Pitt School of Education Heuristic UX Evaluation report
descriptionHtml: Final group project evaluating the user experience of the University of Pittsburgh School of Education admissions site. My team consulted with the Pitt School of Education's site team to identify pain points, ran research with potential users of the site, and presented final findings and recommendations to the client.

title: Rate Your Music Heuristic UX Evaluation report
descriptionHtml: Heuristic usability and accessibility evaluation of Rate Your Music.

title: Ubuntu UX Strategy report
descriptionHtml: Collaborative project evaluating the user experience of Ubuntu and its documentation. My team created user personas to compare usability with other major operating systems.

title: All's Fair in Robot War
descriptionHtml: Analysis of anthropomorphism of artificial intelligence and its relationship to the use of AI in warfare.

title: Hacker's Delight: Redefining Music Technology
descriptionHtml: Audio podcast exploring the relationship between music and technology. Why don't we hold musical innovation to the same degree as "pure" technological innovation? Featured in the University of Pittsburgh English department's Digital Media & Design Showcase.

title: LaCroix Instagram story
descriptionHtml:
Instagram story mockup advertising LaCroix sparkling water in the style of '70s/'80s print ads (with a modern twist).

  • Can images from lacroixwater.com.
  • David photo by Jörg Bittner Unna on Wikimedia, licensed under CC BY-SA 3.0, modified by me.
  • Instagram story mockup by Marina Dillaco, licensed under CC BY 4.0, extended from original.

title: Mistrust in the Age of Panoptic Power
descriptionHtml: Application of Michel Foucault's Panopticon to modern ideas of surveillance.

title: Simulated Management and Labor Dignity
descriptionHtml: Reflection on Simon Head's Mindless and simulacra in the workforce.

title: Inclusive Design class poster
descriptionHtml:
Poster advertising upcoming class offerings with focus on accessible design.

  • Clock and face icons by Font Awesome.
  • Accessibility icon by Alfonso Melolonta Urbán for The Noun Project.

title: Quote poster
descriptionHtml:
Quote poster modeled after American public school minutia: motivational class posters and math textbook covers.

  • Head icons by Adrien Coquet for The Noun Project.
  • 3D objects from Adobe Stock.

title: Rushmore Horror edit
client: Visual Literacy Trailer for Wes Anderson's Rushmore
descriptionHtml: Trailer for Wes Anderson's Rushmore, recut to fit within genre conventions of psychological horror/thriller films.

title: Event poster
descriptionHtml: Poster mock-up for Protomartyr show. This design emulates the band's album cover style. The piece incorporates Andrew Carnegie, a symbol of Pittsburgh's industrial labor history, a salient theme in the band's lyrics.

title: Four Page Design
descriptionHtml:
Music magazine article mockup celebrating the work of Steve Reich. The repeating title recalls Reich's repetitious compositions, which fall out of step to harmonically resonate.

  • Cover photo by Jeffrey Herman.
  • Left photo by Richard Landry.
  • Right photo by Ian Oliver, licensed under CC BY 2.0.

title: GE ad redesign
descriptionHtml:
One-to-one recreation of classic General Electric print ad.

  • Original ad design by General Electric.
  • Headphone image by Retrospekt.
  • Cloud photo by @enginakyurt on Unsplash.
  • "Stereo Tape Escape" photo by /u/11bulletcatcher on reddit.
  • "Stereo Radio Escape" photo by flips288 on eBay.
  • "Stereo Great Escape" photo by eden1tribe1 on eBay.
  • GE logo is a registered trademark of the General Electric Company.

title: Max's Journey
descriptionHtml: Interactive multimedia illustration of boat scene from Maurice Sendak's Where the Wild Things Are. Featured in the University of Pittsburgh English department's Digital Media & Design Showcase.

title: Pitt Campus Corner
descriptionHtml: Contributed front-end design, programming, and documentation to crowd-sourced knowledge site for University of Pittsburgh housing. Iterated according to user feedback from survey. Usability metrics were later analyzed for the Pitt Campus Corner usability report.

title: Burghquest
descriptionHtml: Interactive augmented reality experience exploring Pittsburgh history through regional food and popular culture.

title: Computer Vision Syndrome poster
descriptionHtml: Infographic warning of the dangers of computer vision syndrome. Part of series designed to showcase UX design thinking in a technical writing environment.

title: Frozen Safety poster
descriptionHtml: Print poster promoting safety in the ShopRite frozen foods department. Part of series designed to showcase UX design thinking in a technical writing environment.

title: Pittsburgh Food Deserts
descriptionHtml: Geographic data visualization identifying food deserts within Pittsburgh city limits.

title: ¡Presidente Pedro!
descriptionHtml: Generative narrative study analyzing Midwestern Bush-era attitudes towards race and class in Napoleon Dynamite.

title: Queering the Gaze with Some Fava Beans and a Nice Chianti
descriptionHtml: Analysis of Buffalo Bill and Hannibal Lecter's subversion of Hollywood's heteronormative movie killer tropes in Silence of the Lambs.
